text: Last quarter, Bernie Sanders, Pete Buttigieg and Joe Biden all raised more money than our campaign did. Will you chip in $5, $20 or whatever you can to help this campaign keep fighting?

Every one of the Democratic candidates remaining would make a better president than Donald Trump. But the race for the Democratic nomination is a fractured one. It's not a straightforward narrative captured by glancing at a map, and the process won't be decided by the simple horse race numbers in clickbait headlines. That's never been our focus дуо our focus is on building a broad coalition to win delegates everywhere.

For months, Elizabeth has been near or at the top of the list of candidates that voters are considering for president. According to the latest Economist/YouGov poll, 40-50% of voters across all age groups are considering voting for Warren, including 58% of self-described liberals and 38% of self-described moderates. Elizabeth is best positioned to unite the party and lead the Democratic ticket to defeat Donald Trump.

Our campaign is no stranger to being written off or counted out early. But here's what we do know: Elizabeth has proven the doubters wrong before.

Elizabeth is progressive, effective, and has lived a life that has prepared her for this fight. With a strong organization of more than 1,000 staff on the ground in 31 states, bolstered by a movement of more than 1,000,000 grassroots donors, we are confident that as Americans continue to get to know Elizabeth, they'll see what we see every day: Elizabeth is the only candidate who can unite the party and defeat Donald Trump in November. 

But the only way we'll win this nomination is if everyone reading this digs deep and funds our 100% grassroots-funded campaign. Can you help us keep moving forward? Chip in $2, $20 or whatever you can to power this movement through the critical races to come.

A young woman came up to me after my speech in New Hampshire and told me that she was a college student with thousands of dollars in debt дуо and she only had $6 in her bank account. 

Then she said that she still chipped in $3 to our campaign that night. Because that was how important this campaign was to her. 

Iду»m not done fighting for working people, for students, for anybody who believes that we can make things better than they are now. Our campaign is 100% grassroots funded, and we need everyone to dig in deep and chip in $3, $20, or whatever they can today to help us keep moving forward. Can I count on you?

One thing is clear: itду»s getting harder to save enough for a decent retirement and Social Security has become a main source of income for many of us who are over 65.

Elizabeth has helped lead the fight in Congress to expand Social Security, and her plan would provide the biggest and most progressive increase in Social Security benefits in nearly half a century. If you agree that we need to increase Social Security benefits by $200 a month and update its rules, sign up to join Elizabeth today.

думдуЦI think it is really important that as we go into the 2020 election that we have the best chance to win against Donald Trump,ду» Warren said. дуЦAnd I think what thatду»s going to be is about prosecuting the case on corruption and drawing the distinction between this administration that is the most corrupt in living memory, and having a Democratic nominee who was willing to take on that corruption.ду»дуќ

думдуЦWe win when we have ideas big enough to meet the problems in peopleду»s lives.ду»дуќ

As I travel the country talking to workers at town halls and in selfie lines, I hear that too many face a giant challenge in supporting their families: unpredictable work schedules that leave them with too few hours to afford necessities and no control over their time. 

Across the country, workers are fed up with unpredictable and unfair schedules so theyду»re getting organized - and winning.

My Fair Workweek plan builds on the work of these committed advocates and activists, and ensures that every part-time worker in America is treated with respect and can build a future for themselves and the people they love. It will: 
- Require employers with 15 or more employees to give two weeks of advance notice of work schedules
- Empower employees to ask for schedules that work for them without fear of retaliation.
- Ensure a right to rest between shifts.
- Require employers to offer additional work hours to existing, qualified, part-time workers before hiring new employees or contractors.
- Provide benefits to part-time workers.

Thatду»s my plan, and that is why Iду»m going to win.ду»

думSenator Warren released a robust plan to simplify our bankruptcy system, making it more accessible for families who are currently too broke to file. Her bold solutions to decrease the amount of paperwork, eliminate ineffective credit counseling requirements, and combine two chapters of bankruptcy will help millions of families re-enter our economy. Debt has devastating downstream effects on society that include homelessness, hunger, and poverty. Senator Warrenду»s plan will help stop these problems before they happen.

думSenator Warrenду»s plan is groundbreaking because it uses our bankruptcy system to highlight the Access to Justice Crisis in America, a civil rights issue that has gone largely unnoticed by the general public. Unlike in the criminal justice system, low- and middle-income individuals have no right to any free legal representation in the civil justice system.дуќ

MEET WAYNE
I learned the values of hard work and pride of community from a young age. My parents immigrated to South Florida from Jamaica with just a 5th grade education, seeking greater opportunity for our family. My father labored for 16 years in the sugar cane fields of the Florida Glades after coming to the United States, and my mom would cook to feed the migrant workers. I was born in rural Pahokee, Florida and grew up in South Bay.

Thanks to the opportunity this country provided for my family, the support of my parents and mentors, and lots of time and effort in class and on the field, I earned a full football scholarship to Florida State University, where I started at wide receiver and was a member of the 1993 National Championship team.

After my NFL dreams were cut short, my wife Angela and I built one of the fastest-growing, minority-owned construction businesses in the country and our projects in the educational and non-profit space have garnered national recognition, including from the U.S. Green Building Council for building one of the greenest schools in the Southeast United States.

I then went into public service, first as a city commissioner, then rising to serve as a two-term mayor of Miramarдуоone of Floridaду»s most diverse cities.

Today, Miramar ranks as one of the fastest-growing city economies in the country. We actively foster innovation and development, from starting an aviation expo and tech camps to expose young people to the tools that can solve the problems of today and tomorrow.

I am proud of our record in Miramar as weду»ve:

Fought to bring American jobs back from China.
Passed a living wage for city workers.
Recruited companies with high-paying jobs to hire Floridians.
Led the fight against the oil industryду»s campaign to drill in Big Cypress National Preserve, adjacent to the Everglades and just a few miles from our city.
Joined mayors across the country to oppose climate denialism and pledge to support the goals of the Paris Agreement.
Taken on the Trump administration to protect immigrants, proposing our city as a safe zone for those who come to this country seeking a better life.
Sued the state of Florida to protect our residents from gun violence and overturn a law backed by the NRA.
Proposed and passed relief on water bills for federal workers who were impacted by the shutdown.
My college sweetheart, business partner, and better half Angela and I have been married for more than 20 years as weду»ve built our lives in Miramar and raised our kids. Our three children, Wayne II and twin daughters Kayla and Kyla, attend college in South Florida.

Paid for by Wayne Messam for America

"She is best positioned to win, is the most qualified to positively transform our country and will lead with integrity.дуќ

думAfter over a year of watching the candidates on the campaign trail and interacting with their teams on the ground here in the Granite State, Senator Warrenду»s campaign has stood out as fundamentally unique. Team Warren has put in the work in every county and community, building relationships and progressive infrastructure that will remain long after this campaign cycle is over."

думPrompted by her promise to provide universal child care, quadruple Title I funding for K-12 education and provide free college tuition, 89 Granite Staters who are involved in education, or are retired educators, endorsed Sen. Elizabeth Warren for president.дуќ

думSupporters said Warren, as a mother and former public school teacher, дуЦhas lived these issues and knows what must be done to address them. She has struggled without high quality, affordable child care. She knows how life-changing a college degree can be. And she has spent many years in the classroom -- as a student, a special needs teacher, and as a law professor.ду»дуќ

думMore than 60 Granite State union leaders and members are declaring their support for Sen. Elizabeth Warrenду»s presidential bid for the first time as part of a 100-person organized labor rollout.дуќ

Her plan would strengthen and protect collective bargaining rights, and in turn strengthen unions and rebuild our middle class.ду»дуќ

думдуЦI have student loans. I am trying to make ends meet as a young professional and pay a lot for health insurance. She makes you believe she can do anything, and sheду»s such a contrast to whatду»s currently in the White House. I think we need someone like that to go up against Trump.ду»дуќ

"дуЦI've been thinking about it and thinking about it and thinking about it. And finally, over the last couple of days, everything started to crystallize for me. I said, you know, 'Elizabeth Warren is the one I really think I would like to see as the nominee,'ду» Sullivan told CBS News in a phone interview Tuesday.дуќ

"дуЦShe's got a great personal story. You know, like the public school kid from Oklahoma who made her way through public schools, going to college and law school, on to the United States Senate,ду» she added. дуЦIt's the kid who can grow up to be whatever they want in this country. And that's a story unfortunately not available to all children in this country. And I think she is the person to fix that.ду»дуќ

думI strongly believe that all Granite Staters, regardless of where they live, deserve an equal shot at the American dream дуо and there is one candidate who has demonstrated a meaningful commitment to our rural communities: Sen. Elizabeth Warren.дуќ

For decades, students have worked hard and played by the rules. They took on loans on the promise that a college education would justify their debt and provide a ticket to the middle class. But our countryду»s experiment with debt-financed education went terribly wrong: instead of getting ahead, millions of student loan borrowers are barely treading water.

Iду»ve already proposed bold steps to cancel student loan debt, along with making public two- and four-year colleges and technical schools tuition-free, ban for-profit colleges from receiving federal aid, and help end racial disparities in college enrollment and resources. But the Department of Education already has broad legal authority to cancel student debt, and we canду»t afford to wait for Congress to act. 

So I will start to use existing laws on day one of my presidency to implement my student loan debt cancellation plan that offers relief to 42 million Americans -- in addition to using all available tools to address racial disparities in higher education, crack down on for-profit institutions, and eliminate predatory lending. 

If you agree that we need to tackle the student debt crisis from all angles, sign on to my plan today.

Iду»m proposing a tax on the top 0.1% дуо the Jeff Bezoses and Mark Zuckerbergs of the world дуо that would generate trillions over the next ten years. Sounds good, right? It gets even better: Iду»ll use that money to reinvigorate the middle class by investing in our kids, from cradle to college. 

This plan will pay for:
- Universal child care for our kids, age 0 to 5,
- A great public K-12 education for all of our kids,
- Universal free technical, two-year, and four-year college,
- Student loan debt cancellation for 42 million Americans, and
- A minimum of $50 billion for HBCUs and Minority-Serving Institutions.

These issues are truly personal for me. I started out my career teaching kids with special needs in a public school. Later on I became a law professor and taught many bright minds at the collegiate level too. My dream job was to be a teacher; but I only achieved it because I was lucky to find affordable education options and to have free child care in the form of my Aunt Bee. Thatду»s why Iду»ve proposed the ultra-millionaire tax. The ultra-wealthy made their riches on the backs of American families. Itду»s time for them to pay it forward, and itду»s time for us to tax the ultra-rich. Sign on to join our movement if you agree.

Educators across the country are donating what they can to power this fight. Will you? Chip in now.

Juliнзn has been a powerful voice for bold, progressive change. We both had the honor to serve in President Obamaду»s administration, and now weду»re fighting side by side to ensure that families in our country today can have the same opportunity to achieve their dreams as ours did. 

Itду»s going to take all of us working together to get to the finish line. If youду»re with Juliнзn and me, sign up to join our team today.

In 2005, the banking industry, with its deep pockets and Congressional allies, successfully passed a bankruptcy bill that devastated families across the country who needed relief from debt collection.

That 2005 bill made the 2008 financial crisis significantly worse: experts found that the bill думcaused about 800,000 additional mortgage defaults and 250,000 additional foreclosures.дуќ 

Hereду»s the kicker: the banking industry spent more than $100 million to turn that bill into law because they knew it would be worth much more than that to their bottom lines. And they were right дуо by squeezing families harder, they managed to rake in giant profits. 

Thatду»s why Iду»m announcing my plan to repeal the harmful provisions in the 2005 bankruptcy bill and overhaul consumer bankruptcy rules in this country. If you agree we need to overhaul our consumer bankruptcy system to give people a second chance, sign on to my plan today.

I spent most of my career studying one simple question: why do American families go broke? 

I found that no one дуо not even the supposed думexpertsдуќ дуо had actually dug into the data to figure out what drove families into bankruptcy. So I found two incredible partners and set out to gather the data about why families go broke. That was back when you had to collect information by hand, and courts charged a lot to make copies for you. To save money, I flew around to courthouses all over the country with my own photocopier дуо nicknamed R2D2 дуо strapped into the airplane seat next to me, copying thousands of bankruptcy filings to begin understanding why American families turned to bankruptcy. 

Iду»ll never forget sitting in a wood-paneled courtroom in San Antonio on one of my first trips, watching the families filing for bankruptcy move in and out of the courtroom to appear in front of the judge. They looked just like the family I grew up in дуо hanging on to the ragged edge of the middle class. Now they were standing in front of a judge, ready to give up nearly everything they owned just to get some relief from the bill collectors. 

Our research ended up showing that most of these families werenду»t reckless or irresponsible дуо what many people thought at the time дуо they were just getting squeezed by an economy that forced them to take on more debt and more risk to cling to their place in Americaду»s middle class. And that meant one bad break could send them tumbling over the edge. 

My plan aims to undo the harm of the 2005 banking industry-backed bill that made it harder for families to get the relief they need and overhaul consumer bankruptcy rules. As president, I will:
- Make it easier for people being crushed by debt to obtain relief through bankruptcy.
- Expand peopleду»s rights to take care of themselves and their children while they are in the bankruptcy process.
- End the absurd rules that make it nearly impossible to discharge student loan debt in bankruptcy.
- Let more people protect their homes and cars in bankruptcy so they can start from a firm foundation when they start to pick up the pieces and rebuild their financial lives.
- Help address shameful racial and gender disparities that plague our bankruptcy system.
- Close loopholes that allow the wealthy and corporate creditors to abuse the bankruptcy system at the expense of everyone else. 

If you agree we need to overhaul our consumer bankruptcy system to give people a second chance, sign on to my plan today.
Gold Label: economic, social programs, social cultural, education

text:
From bus blockades in Denver, Section 504 sit-ins in San Francisco, and the Deaf President Now student movement in D.C. to protests outside of Mitch McConnell's office and virtual marches, disability activists across the country have organized over decades to bring the nationду»s attention to the injustices they face. Fighting a world that has excluded, exploited, and institutionalized them, they have put their lives on the line for a more just future and changed this country for the better for everyone.

As President, I will work in partnership with the disability community to combat ableism. I will fight alongside them for justice across all aspects of life and to fulfill the four goals of the ADA: equal opportunity, full participation, independent living, and economic self sufficiency. Iду»ll start by making clear that disability is a priority in my administration, creating a National Office of Disability Coordination to ensure that federal programs work together to support people with disabilities.

We must protect the rights and equality of people with disabilities. If youду»re with me, sign on to my plan today.

Our country is deeply divided, but people across this countryдуоRepublicans, Independents, and Democratsдуоagree that our top priority has to be fighting corruption in Washington.

Weду»re dealing with a president who came to Washington claiming that he would думdrain the swampдуќ of corruption. He broke that promise and has done everything he can to help the wealthy and well-connected.

Iду»m not doing big-dollar fundraisers in exclusive wine caves. Iду»m not selling my time to billionaires. Iду»m not selling ambassadorships to donors. My first priority as president will be to pass the biggest package of anti-corruption reforms since Watergate.

Weду»re going to shut the revolving door between Wall Street and Washington, end lobbying as we know it, and take power away from the rich and powerful and put it where it belongsдуоin the hands of the American people. Americans are ready to root out corruption and fight backдуоand Iду»ve got a plan for that.

Right now, we're in the most critical period we'll ever have in this election, and we need to kick things into high gear to run the strongest campaign possible in the last weeks before voting begins.

So today, we're launching the three-day "Big, Structural Change Fund" to raise the resources we need to make critical investments in ads, outreach, and organizing ahead of the first primaries. And we're hoping to fill it with 30,000 donations in the next three days.

But our fund entirely relies on grassroots support from posts just like this one. Can you chip in $2 or anything you can to the Big, Structural Change Fund? Your donation to this fund will support our outreach efforts during this critical time.

The billionaires in wine caves are ready to clink glasses and celebrate because theyду»re confident that having more money than you means theyду»ll be able to drown out your voice in this process to choose the Democratic nominee.

Asking supporters like you to chip in is the only way weду»re going to try to catch up on fundraising. There are no wealthy donors in high-rise penthouses or outside super PACs coming to the rescue. Just you, and thousands of other supporters like you, digging deep to pitch in what they can to do this.

Elizabeth is proud that weду»re running a 100% grassroots-funded campaign. She wouldnду»t have it any other way. But if there were ever a time for every grassroots supporter to step up, itду»s now.

So far this quarter, weду»ve raised a little over $17 million. Thatду»s a good chunk behind where we were at this time last quarter. The good news? We have until midnight on December 31 to get things going.

Elizabeth needs your help. Right now. The goal is $20 million for the quarter дуо thatду»s how much the campaign needs to keep our plans on track.

Please chip in $20, $5, or whatever you can to help close the fundraising gap and continue building our ground game at the most critical point before the primaries and caucuses start.

_ф_„ Elizabeth Warren.
_ф_„ Jonathan Van Ness.

Prosecutors are also enormously powerful and often not subject to scrutiny or accountability. I will support a set of reforms that would rein in the most egregious prosecutorial abuses and make the system fairer, including reducing the use of coercive plea bargaining at the federal level and putting in place responsible standards for evidence gathering. And Iду»ll create an independent prosecutorial integrity unit to hold accountable prosecutors who abuse their power.

If you want to help fight for a fairer justice system, sign up now.

Our government is paralyzed. Why? Because the wealthy and giant corporations spend billions every year to get Washington to put their interests ahead of the public interest. We need to call this what it isдуоcorruption, plain and simple. 

Corruption has put our planet at risk, broken our economy, and it is breaking our democracy.

I have the biggest anti-corruption plan since Watergate, to tackle the corruption thatду»s squeezing working people and undermining our democracy.

I know whatду»s broken in this country. Learn more about my plan to fix it.

Hereду»s the deal: itду»s really me calling grassroots donors who chip in whatever they can to help build this grassroots movement. Instead of spending time at exclusive fundraising events with wealthy donors who write big checks, Iду»d rather talk with people like you about the issues that you care about. 

There wonду»t be any special cocktail hours with fancy appetizers for the biggest donors on this campaign, and thatду»s perfectly fine with me, because Iду»m running the campaign I want to runдуо a campaign powered by a grassroots movement, not the wealthy and well-connected. 

I hope I get to personally call and thank you for chipping in to my campaign. Can I count on you? Chip in now and keep your phone onдуоIf you get a call from an unknown number, it might just be me!

Weду»ll be honest with youдуоWall Street and Silicon Valley are excited about some of the other Democrats running for president. 

Other candidates are raising big bucks from fancy fundraisers with millionaires and billionaires. One candidate just spent an evening in a думwine caveдуќ in Napa Valley adorned with chandeliers with more than a thousand Swarovski crystals.

Iду»m running to be the best president that money canду»t buy. That means Iду»m not cozying up to the wealthy and well-connected the way some other candidates are. Iду»m not hosting any fundraisers where you can only meet me if you can write a check for $2,800. And I'm not taking any money from Washington lobbyists or PACs of any kind.

You'll always know that I'm fighting for you дуо not for any powerful special interest with deep pockets.

I'm grateful down to my toes for everyone who knocks on doors, make phone calls, texts their friends about our new plans, hosts debate watch parties, and chips in $3 at a time. For everyone who makes this campaign their own. For everyone who's in this fight all the way.

Our grassroots movement is up against a big test. On the FEC filing deadline on December 31st, we'll release a public report on how much we've raised in the past three months and how many people have chipped in to own a piece of our campaign.

We need those fundraising numbers to be as strong as possible, and we're behind where we want to be to hit our fundraising goals.

We can show the power of grassroots donors coming together as one movement. Will you chip in $5, $20 or whatever you can to help grow our grassroots movement?

Climate scientists published new research suggesting the planet is hurtling towards an ecological tipping point that would irreversibly damage the earth and threaten our livable climate дуо for good. This most recent study adds to the growing body of evidence that climate change is happening faster than scientists originally thought. And it further reinforces what we already know: we have roughly a decade left to avoid catastrophic impacts by ending our economic dependence on fossil fuels and substantially reducing global emissions. 

But while climate change presents an urgent threat, it also presents the greatest opportunity of our time: the chance to rebuild our economy with 100% clean energy, to address the racial and economic inequality embedded in our fossil fuel economy, and to create millions of good, union jobs in the process. 

America has a long and proud history of rising to the challenges that have faced this country дуо and defeating the climate crisis is no exception. A Warren administration will ensure that as we fight climate change, each and every American benefits from the opportunities created by the clean economy дуо creating 10.6 million new green jobs topower our transition to 100% clean energy. 

We will invest in these green jobs to:
- Expand job training
- Partner with unions to rebuild the middle class
- Move to 100% clean energy
- Transform the energy, transportation, water, and housing sectors to make room for these new jobs

If youду»re with me on creating green jobs for the future of our country, sign on today.

Donald Trump has spent his career embracing shady deals. Trump has repeatedly partnered with shady actors on real estate deals that reek of money laundering, corruption, and fraud. More than one-fifth of all Trumpду»s U.S. condo sales since the 1980s have been all-cash transactions with shell companies дуо red flags that often indicate money laundering. At one of Trumpду»s towers in Florida, more than 60 percent of its units are owned by shell companies. And it doesnду»t stop with real estate дуо over half of Trumpду»s more than 500 companies are registered in Delaware, taking advantage of state loopholes that exempt LLCs from publishing their financial information or disclosing their ownership structure.  

Iду»ve introduced the most ambitious set of domestic anti-corruption reforms since Watergate to clean up our government. But we must go further. Our domestic challenges are compounded by a global network that connects secretive shell companies, complicated trusts, middlemen and enablers that specialize in papering suspicious transactions, and states and countries that profit from a lack of transparency. To truly root out corruption, we must also tackle the flow of dark money around the world. If youду»re with me, sign on today.

This campaign is powered entirely by folks like you дуо no super PACs, no corporate PACs, no high-dollar, closed-door fundraisers. 

Weду»re building a grassroots movement to put power in the hands of people. That means rooting out corruption in Washington, strengthening our democracy, and making sure the wealthy pay their fair share. Weду»re fighting for big, structural change in this country, and I canду»t do it without your help. 

Thatду»s why Iду»m asking for your help today. Donating now is more important than ever as we approach the last FEC deadline before votes are cast in the new year. 

Our daily donor goal in New York is 256. If everyone who sees this ad chips in just $5, weду»d hit that goal in no time. Donate what you can today to help our grassroots campaign move forward.

While the majority of Americans дуо including a majority of gun owners дуо support sensible gun control, even the most basic proposals are consistently blocked by far-right members of Congress who are bought and paid for by the gun industry, their NRA partners, and a supporting army of lobbyists and lawyers. 

In 2017, almost 40,000 people died from guns in the United States. My goal as president, and for our society, will be to reduce that number by 80%.
 
As president, I will immediately take executive action to rein in an out-of-control gun industry дуо and to hold both gun dealers and manufacturers accountable for the gun violence.
I will break the NRAду»s stranglehold on Congress by passing sweeping anti-corruption legislation and eliminating the filibuster to free our nation from the small group of well-financed extremists who have already made it perfectly clear that they will never put the safety of the American people first.

I will send Congress comprehensive gun violence prevention legislation. I will sign it into law within my first 100 days. And we will revisit this comprehensive legislation every single year to continually reduce the number of gun deaths in America.

If you agree that itду»s time to take action on guns and save lives, add your name.

Under a Warren administration, weду»ll prohibit anyone convicted of a hate crime from owning a gun. Too often, guns are used in acts of mass violence intended to provoke fear in minority communities. More than 10,000 hate crimes involve a gun every year. Any individual convicted of a hate crime should be permanently prohibited from owning a gun, full stop. 

Domestic violence and gun violence are deeply connected. In an average month, more than 50 women are shot and killed by an intimate partner. Iду»ll close the boyfriend loophole, but Congress should make that permanent, and expand the law to include individuals with restraining orders or who have been convicted of stalking.

The shooting in El Paso also reminds us that we need to call out white nationalism for what it is: domestic terrorism. Instead of a president who winks and nods as white nationalism gets stronger in this country, we need a president who will use all the tools available to prevent it. It is completely incompatible with our American values, it is a threat to American safety and security, and a Warren Justice Department will prosecute it to the fullest extent of the law.

If youду»re with me, sign up now.

The BP Deepwater Horizon oil spill дуо the worst oil spill in our nation's history дуо caused more than $17 billion in damage to natural resources and cost eleven lives. Years later, coastal economies and ecosystems along the Gulf Coast have still not recovered. On day one of my presidency I will sign a sweeping executive order with bold actions to defeat the climate crisis, including ending all new fossil fuel leases offshore and on public lands. 

But new offshore fossil fuel leases are only part of the problem дуо we must also phase out existing offshore drilling, which is putting the health and economies of coastal communities at risk. 

If youду»re with me on ending offshore drilling, sign on today.

Last year the Kavanaugh nomination was rammed through the Senate without a thorough examination of the allegations against him. Confirmation is not exoneration, and no president or Supreme Court justice is above the law. Like the man who appointed him, Kavanaugh should be impeached.

Add your name to our petition if you agree.

As we pursue climate justice, we must not lose sight of the 71% of our planet covered by the ocean. Thatду»s why I believe that a Blue New Deal must be an essential part of any Green New Deal. Hereду»s what my administration will do: 
- Rebuild our blue economy by expanding offshore renewable energy, investing in regenerative ocean farming, building climate smart ports, and more
- Protect and restore ocean habitats and hold Big Ag accountable for pollution
- End offshore drilling to prevent future crises like the BP Deepwater Horizon oil spill
- Bolster pre- and post-disaster mitigation

If you agree that we need to save our oceans, sign on today.

The BP Deepwater Horizon oil spill дуо the worst oil spill in our nation's history дуо caused more than $17 billion in damage to natural resources and cost eleven lives. Years later, coastal economies and ecosystems along the Gulf Coast have still not recovered. On day one of my presidency I will sign a sweeping executive order with bold actions to defeat the climate crisis, including ending all new fossil fuel leases offshore and on public lands. 

But new offshore fossil fuel leases are only part of the problem -- we must also phase out existing offshore drilling, which is putting the health and economies of coastal communities at risk. A Warren administration will start by reinstating the Obama Administrationду»s Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Program that protected more than hundreds of millions of acres in the Atlantic Ocean and Arctic. Weду»ll also reinstate the well safety rules that the Obama administration put in place after the BP oil spill, because the fossil fuel workers who risk their lives to power our economy deserve safe working conditions. And weду»ll roll back the Trump administrationду»s decision to reduce the shallow-water royalty rate for existing offshore drilling leases. In fact, weду»ll go further: weду»ll reassess the royalty rate to more accurately account for the social cost of carbon. Over the last two decades, some of the worldду»s largest oil companies, including Chevron, Exxon, and Shell, have skirted about $18 billion in federal royalties from offshore drilling. That ends in a Warren Administration. 

I will direct federal ocean and coastal management agencies to begin planning to phase out all offshore drilling. Instead, we will focus on transitioning the offshore drilling supply chain and associated industry to offshore wind. I am committed to leaving no worker behind as we transition to 100% clean energy, and the men and women who have tirelessly worked in the offshore drilling industry are no exception. A Warren administration will provide job training and guaranteed wage and benefit parity for workers who choose to transition into new industries. And for those Americans who choose not to find new employment and wish to retire with dignity, weду»ll ensure full financial security, including promised pensions and early retirement benefits. 

If youду»re with me on ending offshore drilling, sign on today.

Can you believe?! Queer Eye grooming expert and LGBTQ+ activist Jonathan Van Ness is on Team Warren! _ф_Љ

Jonathan joined Team Warren because he knows that health care is a human right and that Elizabeth will fight for human rights. Now heду»s working to spread the word about our grassroots campaign.

If you want to join our movement and stand with Elizabeth and Jonathan, donate today to help reach a huge milestone: one million donors powering this movement. Even $5 helps! Click the link дуо it only takes about 30 seconds.

My friend, Jonathan Van Ness, volunteered to help me call and thank some of our grassroots donors! This campaign is powered entirely by a grassroots movement - no super PACs, no big corporations, no high-dollar closed-door fundraisers. 

Jonathan and I are in this fight together, and weду»re counting on you to join us. Donate today and help hit our goal before our next major FEC deadline on December 31.

The 1994 crime billду»s mandatory minimums and думtruth-in-sentencingдуќ provisions that require offenders to serve the vast majority of their sentences have not proven effective. Congress should reduce or eliminate these provisions, giving judges more flexibility in sentencing decisions.Thatду»s how we start to reduce mass incarceration in this country. If youду»re with me, sign up now.

Policies like stop-and-frisk and думbroken windowsдуќ policing have trampled the constitutional rights of countless Americans дуо particularly those from Black and brown communities дуо without any measurable impact on violent crime. Iду»ll end stop-and-frisk by directing the Justice Department to withhold federal funding from law enforcement agencies that continue to employ it and other similar practices, and Iду»ll work with Congress to pass legislation to prohibit profiling at all levels of law enforcement. 

If you want to end stop-and-frisk, sign up now.

The Sixth Amendment provides every American accused of a crime with the right to an attorney дуо but too many defendants cannot afford one, and too often, public defenders are under-resourced, overworked, and overwhelmed. If we expect fair trials, we need to balance resources on both sides of each case, everywhere. Iду»ll fund federal public defenders and expand targeted grant funding for public defenders at the state level, to ensure that they have the tools to effectively defend their clients. We should ensure that our public defenders are paid a fair salary for their work, and that their caseloads allow for the comprehensive defense of their clients. And Iду»ll provide funding for language and cultural competency training, including on gender identity and treatment of individuals with disabilities, so that public defenders are best able to serve their clients.

If you want to help fight for a fairer justice system, sign up now.

The United States makes up 5% of the worldду»s population, but nearly 20% of the worldду»s prison population. We have the highest rate of incarceration in the world, with over 2 million people in prison and jail. Our system is the result of the dozens of choices weду»ve made дуо choices that together stack the deck against the poor and the disadvantaged. To make matters worse, the evidence is clear that there are structural race problems in this system. Today in America, there is one criminal justice system for the rich and powerful, and another one for everybody else. Itду»s long past time for us to reform our system. 

Under my new plan, we will reduce incarceration and improve justice in our country by changing what we choose to criminalize, reforming police behavior and improving police-community relations, and making structural changes to our justice system. When people are incarcerated, we will provide opportunities for treatment, education and rehabilitation, and weду»ll continue those supports for returning citizens as they rejoin our communities. Most importantly, weду»ll rethink the way we approach public safety дуо emphasizing preventative approaches over law enforcement and incarceration. Thatду»s the way weду»ll create real law and order and real justice in our country. 

If youду»re ready to fight for equal justice under the law, sign up now.

Studies show that capital punishment is often applied in a manner biased against people of color and those with a mental illness. I oppose the death penalty. A Warren administration would reverse Trumpду»s decision to move forward with federal executions, and Congress should abolish the death penalty entirely.

If you think we should abolish the death penalty, sign up now.

The vast majority of police officers sign up so they can protect their communities. But many people of color disproportionately experience trauma at the hands of law enforcement, sometimes with life-altering consequences. On average, three people are shot and killed by the police every day, a disproportionate number of them young and Black. Others are arrested and entered into a system that unduly penalizes even minor infractions. Itду»s time to fundamentally change how police work is done in America: funding what works; replacing failed policies with effective, evidence-based practices that do not violate individual rights; and reframing our approach to public safety to prioritize prevention over punishment. 

We will improve justice in our country by reforming police behavior and improving police-community relations. If youду»re with me, sign up now.

Elizabeth Warren is returning to New Hampshire! She will deliver a speech addressing how corruption has fueled the economic challenges facing working families and her plans to stop the corruption, increase economic growth, promote competition and innovation, and build an economy that works for everyone. This event will be held at Saint Anselm College on Thursday, December 12th. Doors open for the event at 10:00AM and the event will begin at 11:00AM.

Iду»m grateful for every grassroots supporter who chipped in to help us raise $24.6 million in the third quarter. This grassroots movement is only possible when we all fight together. Will you chip in today to help make the next selfie line possible and grow this movement?

Billionaire Mike Bloomberg just placed the largest week of TV advertising of any presidential candidate in history дуо $34 million in one week (and growing!). You might even start seeing his ads soon. The reason? He's trying to use his personal fortune to buy his way to the Democratic nomination. 

Elizabeth's campaign is powered by grassroots supporters like you. But now it's going to take even more to make sure we can get our message out around the country.

If you agree with Elizabeth that the Democratic primary shouldn't be for sale to the richest billionaire, chip in now to help power or movement.

As some of the other Democratic campaigns have begun to stall, handfuls of their wealthy supporters are gearing up to start Super PACs for candidates who canду»t mobilize enough grassroots support.

That means Wall Street, billionaires, and giant corporations can dump unlimited sums of money into the Democratic primary to back whatever candidate they think will help them most. 

Theyду»ve seen the strength of our grassroots movement, and they know that if we win, weду»ll take political and economic power out of their hands and put it where it belongs дуо in the hands of the people.

Those powerful special interests are ready to jump at the chance to spend ridiculous amounts of money in the primary дуо and against everything weду»re fighting for.

Thatду»s where you come in. Weду»re building a grassroots movement powered by folks like you, not billionaires or CEOs. If youду»re ready to join us, chip in whatever you can today.

Elizabethду»s Ultra-Millionaire Taxдуоa two-cent tax on fortunes above $50 millionдуоwould pay for universal child care, canceling student loan debt for 95% of those who have it, a minimum $50 billion investment in HBCUs, and more. 

But lately, some of the wealthy few that would be affected by the tax have started going on national television, literally shedding tears, writing op-eds, and trying to stop our movement in its tracks. And now Michael Bloombergдуоone of the first billionaires to attack Elizabethду»s plan for a wealth taxдуоis taking steps to enter the Democratic primary. 

The wealthy and well-connected are scared that, under a Warren presidency, they would no longer have a government that caters to their every need. So theyду»re doing everything they can to try to stop Elizabeth and our grassroots movement from winning. 

Letду»s defeat the billionaires and make our government and our economy work for working people. Chip in now.

Kamala Harris and Kirsten Gillibrand дуо two women senators who, together, won more than 11.5 million votes in their last elections дуо have been forced out of this race, while billionaires Tom Steyer and Michael Bloomberg have been allowed to buy their way in.

Our democracy should not be for sale, and yet, billionaires have been able to use their money to try to buy this election outright.

Elizabeth is running to be the best president that money can't buy. She doesn't sell her time to the wealthy, doesn't hold fancy fundraisers with special access for big donors, and isn't beholden to corporate interests or their lobbyists. She's in this fight for working people.

We're going to root out corruption in Washington right at the source дуо and level the playing field for working people in this country. Sign on to join our grassroots movement.

Homeownership is out of reach for too many families дуо especially Black families. Decades of outright discrimination by the federal government denied Black families the same kinds of homeownership subsidies available to white families. Then government regulators ignored warning signs as predatory financial institutions targeted minority communities with subprime mortgages that sucked billions of dollars in wealth out of those communities.

The black homeownership rate today is nearly the same as it was when housing discrimination was legal. And weду»re not going to solve our housing crisis by nibbling at the edges. We need to tackle it head on дуо with big, comprehensive solutions that match the size of the problems we have. Thatду»s what my housing plan for America does.

Financial institutions and the insurance industry underwrite and fund dirty fossil fuel investments around the world, and they could play a key role in stopping the climate crisis. Instead, the big banks have actually increased their fossil fuel investments since the Paris Climate Agreement was signed.

Higher education opened a million doors for me. Itду»s how the daughter of a janitor got to become a teacher, a law school professor, a U.S. Senator, and eventually, a candidate for President of the United States.

Today, itду»s virtually impossible for a young person to find that kind of opportunity. As states have invested less per-student at community colleges and public four-year colleges, the schools themselves have raised tuition and fees to make up the gap. And rather than stepping in to hold states accountable, or to pick up more of the tab and keep costs reasonable, the federal government went with a third option: pushing families that canду»t afford to pay the outrageous costs of higher education towards taking out loans.

Thatду»s why Iду»m calling for something truly transformational дуо the cancellation of up to $50,000 in student loan debt for 42 million Americans.

Once weду»ve cleared out the debt thatду»s holding down an entire generation of Americans, we must ensure that we never have another student debt crisis again. We can do that by recognizing that a public college education is like a public K-12 education дуо a basic public good that should be available to everyone with free tuition and zero debt at graduation.

"ду»Anybody in here have student loan debt?ду» Warren asked the crowd. дуЦAnybody in here know someone with student loan debt? Okay, I think we got almost everybody.ду»

думShe then asked people in the audience to take out their phones and plug their student debt amounts into the calculator, which can be found directly on her 2020 presidential campaign website.

думThe calculator poses a short series of questions дуо about what type of schooling an individual took out loans for, how much student debt they accumulated, and how much their total income was the previous year. The calculator then uses that information to determine exactly how much of that individual's student debt would be canceled under Warren's plan.

думAccording to CNN, Warren's plan would eliminate up to $50,000 in student debt for anyone living in a household that earns less than $100,000 per year. People from households that make between $100,000 and $250,000 annually would have student debt canceled on a sliding scale proportional to their income, Business Insider reported, while those from households making $250,000 or more would not qualify for any student debt cancellation.дуќ

"дуЦ[The] plan, which would impose a 2% tax on fortunes over $50 million, would fund universal child care and pre-kindergarten, provide tuition-free college, invest $50 billion into historically black colleges, and cancel student loan debt for an estimated 42 million people,ду» she said on the Des Moines Register Political Soapbox at the Iowa State Fair on Saturday.

"In Iowa alone, Warren has attended 36 events, spoken to more than 7,000 Iowans and taken almost 5,000 selfies over eight trips. She also employs more than 50 paid staff members in the state, which has garnered the attention of top local Democrats.

It comes to us...to get organized, to build a grassroots movement, to persist and to build the country of our best values,ду» Warren said, wrapping up her stump speech. думWarren told the crowd that sheду»s spent her adult life working to answer the questions дуЦWhy has the path gotten so rocky for working people in America?ду» and why are things дуЦparticularly rocky for African Americans?ду»

Violent white nationalist attacks take place at different times, in different places across our country, but they share much in common. They were intended to create fear. They were motivated by hate and bias. And they are incompatible with our values and have no place in American life. 

The FBI logged more than 7,000 hate crimes last year, and the governmentду»s own surveys suggest there are hundreds of thousands more that go unreported or uncategorized. 

In a Warren administration, we will use every tool we have to defeat domestic right-wing terrorism. Hereду»s what weду»ll do: 
- Weду»ll prioritize the investigation and prosecution of white nationalist violence using the resources of the Departments of Justice and Homeland Security.
- Weду»ll tackle gun violence by expanding background checks, keeping guns out of the hands of those who may be violent, and preventing perpetrators of hate crimes from owning firearms. 
- Weду»ll invest in early prevention of extremist violence, teaching tolerance, and addressing incitement of violence on the Internet. 
- Weду»ll reform our police forces to protect targeted communities by tackling racially discriminatory policing, separating law enforcement from immigration enforcement, and better holding officers accountable when they violate a personду»s constitutional rights. 

To take on hate, we all have to stand up against it дуо together. Thatду»s why Iду»m in this fight, and I hope youду»ll join me. Sign on today.

Insurance companies, big pharma, and Republicans will fight any plan to improve health care. Making it all the way to Medicare for All wonду»t be easy, but Iду»ll fight my heart out to get this done for one simple reason. I spent a lifetime learning from working families who go broke. A huge reason for that is health care costs. 

Families shouldnду»t go bankrupt because of health care costs. When Iду»m president, Iду»m going to do everything in my power to make sure that never happens to another person again. 

Hereду»s my plan дуо and it starts the day I take office: 
- In my first 100 days Iду»ll give everyone 50 and older the option to enroll in the existing Medicare program and let every person in America join a Medicare for All option for little or no cost.
- Iду»ll lower the cost of lifesaving drugs like insulin.

By the end of my third year as president, weду»ll vote to transition everyone to Medicare for All. At this point, millions of Americans will likely have already experienced the full benefits of Medicare for All. All three of my brothers served in the military, so I know the responsibility we have to our service members, military families, and veterans. As Commander-in-Chief, I will lead our Armed Forces with awareness of the unique challenges service members and military families face, and the difficulties veterans encounter as they navigate the VA during their transition to civilian life. We need to exercise care in how we deploy our forces abroad, and we need to care for our veterans after they take off the uniform. I will prioritize our most important strategic asset дус our people дус as we reform Pentagon spending and address our most pressing national security crises. The way I see it, this is not complicated. Itду»s about a government that keeps its promises to those who served дуо itду»s about our values. 

We can honor our veterans by ending these endless wars, reining in our bloated defense budget and reducing the influence of defense contractors at the Pentagon, and bringing our troops home responsibly дуо and then providing our veterans with the benefits theyду»ve earned. 

Thatду»s why Iду»ve put together a comprehensive plan to keep our promises to service members, veterans, and military families. Sign up today if youду»re with me on this.

Today, climate change poses both an existential threat and a scientific challenge. We already see its effects дуо record floods, devastating wildfires, 100-year storms that happen every year дуо costing lives and billions of dollars in damage.
 
Hereду»s my plan to help tackle climate change head-on: Invest $2 trillion over the next ten years in American green research, manufacturing, and exporting дуо linking American innovation directly to American jobs, and helping achieve the ambitious domestic and international targets of the Green New Deal.

The science is clear: even if we reduce Americaду»s emissions so that they are net-zero by 2030, we will still fall far short of the reduction in global emissions needed to avert a climate crisis. We need widespread domestic and international adoption of clean, renewable, and emission-free energy technology to meet the goals of the Green New Deal. Thatду»s why Iду»m proposing a Green Marshall Plan дуо a commitment to use all the tools in our diplomatic and economic arsenal to encourage other countries to purchase and deploy American-made clean energy technology. This includes a new federal office dedicated to selling American-made clean, renewable, and emission-free energy technology abroad and a $100 billion commitment to assisting countries to purchase and deploy this technology. I believe in Americaду»s public schools, and I believe that every kid in America should have the same access to a high-quality public education дуо no matter what zip code they live in, the color of their skin, or how much money their parents make.

Integrated schools improve educational outcomes for students of all races. And integrated schools are demanded by our Constitution.

The Supreme Courtду»s ruling blocking the citizenship question on the 2020 Census is a welcome relief дуо but the Court has left open the possibility that the Trump administration could still add a citizenship question to preemptively rig the results of the 2020 Census.

Right-wing extremists Steve Bannon and Kris Kobach pushed the Trump administration to add the question to suppress the count of immigrants, and Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross lied about these contacts. Since then, the Trump administration has made every effort to conceal evidence about the racist and partisan decision to add the citizenship question to the 2020 Census. 

Make no mistake: The Trump administration pushed to add the question to scare Latinx Americans and suppress the count in immigrant communities so that these communities would be deprived of representation, funding, and necessary services. We cannot allow these intimidation tactics to succeed in silencing our voices дуо and thatду»s why we must fight back.

If the Trump administration somehow manages to get a citizenship question back on the Census, I would cancel that rigged Census and replace it with a fair and accurate one. And Iду»ll make this promise right now: A Warren administration would never include a citizenship question on the Census.

President Trump has weaponized deportation in ways that are costly, ineffective, and designed to maximize pain. Itду»s time to end this cruelty дуо and refocus on true threats to public safety and national security instead. As president, I will decriminalize migration and refocus enforcement on serious criminal activity.

Entering the country without authorization has always been a violation of civil immigration law, but thanks to a former segregationist Senator, itду»s also a criminal violation. Since the early 2000s, this additional criminal provision has been used to build and sustain a massive immigration detention complex. 

In 2016, over half of all federal criminal prosecutions were for immigration violations дуо more than prosecutions for terrorism, organized crime, hate crimes, or financial fraud. This obsessive focus ties up federal prosecutors and overwhelms federal courts. Itду»s costly and unnecessary. And under Trump, it has become increasingly abusive. 
As president, I will immediately issue guidance to end criminal prosecutions for simple administrative immigration violations. If youду»re with me, sign up today.

Our laws and our values compel us to help those fleeing violence and oppression, but Trumpду»s racism has contributed to a climate of fear for those seeking refuge in our country. At a time when 70 million are displaced around the world, President Trump has abused his authority to lower the refugee cap for the United States, admitting just over 22,000 refugees in total last year. 

As president, Iду»ll welcome 125,000 refugees in my first year, and ramp up to at least 175,000 refugees per year by the end of my first term. We should welcome those fleeing violence, not imprison them in cages. So I will reverse Trumpду»s efforts to stack the deck against asylum applicants. Iду»ll ensure that asylum seekers can safely present themselves at ports of entry, and expand asylum protections for those fleeing domestic or gang violence and for gender identity and sexual orientation-based claims.

If youду»re with me, sign up now.

States with strict licensing requirements experience lower rates of gun trafficking and violence. A license is required to drive a car, and Congress should establish a similar system for the purchase of any type of firearm or ammunition. As president, Iду»ll create a federal licensing system to ensure that safe, responsible ownership is the standard for everyone who chooses to own a gun. 

If youду»re with me, sign up now.

When I was growing up, before Roe v. Wade, people still got abortions. Some were lucky. Others werenду»t. They all went through hell. The overwhelming majority of Americans have no desire to return to the world before Roe v. Wade. And so the time to act is now. 

Iду»ve got a plan to create federal, statutory rights that would invalidate state bans and protect the right to have an abortion nationwide. Add your name if youду»re with me and ready to fight.

When individuals who are paid to influence politicians also funnel money into the campaigns of those same politicians, that sounds like legalized bribery. My anti-corruption plan will end the corrupting influence of lobbyists throughout our government, including banning lobbyists from donating, bundling, and fundraising for candidates. Itду»s time to put power in the hands of the people where it belongs дуо sign up now if you agree.

Citizens United cleared the way for massive super PACs and dark money organizations that funnel hundreds of millions of dollars into our politics on behalf of largely unknown donors. Every organization that makes an election-related expenditure should be required to promptly disclose their large donors. And super PACs and other dark money groups must provide enough information about the sources of their money so the American people can trace it back to the ultimate individuals and entities that are funding them дуо not just the shell organizations used to conceal those sources.

If youду»re ready to put an end to dark money in politics, sign up now.

Right now, our system of funding elections allows individuals and PACs to donate huge sums of money to candidates and parties. We need to empower ordinary people through a small-dollar public financing system that gives candidates an incentive to spend more time courting working people, rather than just big donors. 

My plan will include a public financing program that would give a 6-1 match for small dollar contributions, less than $200. The program will be funded by penalties coming from corporate malfeasance and major tax crimes. Our democracy shouldnду»t be bought and paid for by the wealthy and powerful. It belongs to all of us.

Sign up now to fight for publicly funded elections.

Weду»re getting organized in cities and states all across the country, and weду»re looking for people like you to join us. Sign up to volunteer and our grassroots team will get in touch with you about ways to take action in your area!

For decades, the FDA has banned gay and bisexual men from donating blood. This ban is outdated, discriminatory, and reduces the already limited blood supply. I helped lead the fight against this discriminatory ban and pushed the FDA to change its policies. While this change was an improvement, it does not go far enough. As president, I would lift this ban completely and make sure that any restrictions around blood donations are grounded in science and based on individual risk factors. 

If youду»re ready to end the discriminatory blood donation ban for gay and bisexual men, sign up now.

We must prevent the weaponization of religion to discriminate against or harm LGBTQ+ people. The freedom of worship is a core American value. But the Trump White House has weaponized the language of religion by giving federal agencies, government contractors, and grantees a license to discriminate against LGBTQ+ people, as long as they claim they discriminated for a religious reason. Religious liberty should not be used to shield bigotry. As president, I will fight to pass the Do No Harm Act to guarantee that religious freedom canду»t be used to harm LGBTQ+ people.

Sign up now if youду»re with me.

Too many transgender and non-binary people can be outed or put in danger when presenting identification documents that are not consistent with their gender identity. As president, I will make it easier for transgender Americans to change their birth certificates, passports, and other forms of identification, and I support including a third gender marker to recognize non-binary Americans. 

Sign up now if youду»re with me.

We must institute a nationwide ban on conversion therapy. This cruel practice has been widely discredited and has already harmed hundreds of thousands of people. As president, I will ensure that no federal dollars are used to support conversion therapy and will take executive action to end conversion therapy against LGBTQ+ minors. 

Sign up now to join our fight to ban conversion therapy.

Today, federal law still does not expressly prohibit firing a transgender person because of their gender identity, evicting a bisexual person because their same-sex partner moves in, or deliberately misgendering a non-binary student in the classroom. As president, I will fight to pass the Equality Act to explicitly guarantee that no LGBTQ+ person in America is discriminated against for who they are or who they love. 

There should be absolutely no question that LGBTQ+ people have equal rights under the law. Thatду»s why Iду»m an original co-sponsor of the Equality Act, which would amend existing civil rights laws to explicitly ban discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation and gender identity in employment, housing, health care, education, public accommodations, credit, jury selection, and all federally-funded services. And if Senate Republicans put small-minded partisanship ahead of protecting these rights, I will end the filibuster so that we have a path to getting critical legislation like the Equality Act passed. 

Sign up now to join our fight to pass the Equality Act.
Gold Label: social cultural, economic, social programs, governance, health, education

text:
Lesbian, gay, and bisexual youth are almost five times as likely to have attempted suicide as their straight peers. Ten percent of transgender people aged 18-25 reported having attempted suicide in the last year. As president, Iду»ll fight to make sure every LGBTQ+ young person is treated with dignity, fairness, and love at home and in school.

This starts by banning discrimination against sexual orientation and gender identity in our adoption agencies and child welfare system. We must also institute a nationwide ban on conversion therapy. And I will make it easier to change identification documents to reflect a personду»s gender identity.

We must make schools safe environments for LGBTQ+ students. In 2017, more than half of LGBTQ+ students reported feeling unsafe at school because of their sexual orientation, and over 70% of LGBTQ+ students reported being verbally harassed or bullied. As a consequence, more than a third of LGBTQ+ students missed school during the previous month because they felt unsafe or uncomfortable. 

As president, Iду»ll fight to make sure every young LGBTQ+ person has an equal opportunity to thrive. If youду»re with me, sign up now.
Gold Label: social cultural, social programs, safety, health, education

text:
The Supreme Court just heard three cases that threaten to roll back LGBTQ+ rights, allowing employers to fire workers because of their sexual orientation or gender identity. Now that President Trump has appointed two new Justices, Brett Kavanaugh and Neil Gorsuch, the Supreme Court could set LGBTQ+ rights back by years.  

No matter what happens at the Supreme Court, we need a president who will lift up the voices of every LGBTQ+ person, stand up to discrimination, and fight back. And as president, I will fight shoulder to shoulder with them дус because no one should ever be unsafe, unheard, or disempowered because of who they are or who they love. 

If youду»re ready to fight for LGBTQ+ equality with me, sign up now.

We have made incredible strides and medical advancements toward ending the HIV/AIDS epidemic, but HIV/AIDS remains a public health crisis with 1.1 million people continuing to live with HIV in the U.S. today. A majority of these people are LGBTQ+, are from communities of color, and are contending with multiple barriers that prevent them from getting the care they need. We must demand more for them and for their futures. 

I will fight to increase funding for federal HIV/AIDS programs and research like the Ryan White Program, including the Minority HIV/AIDS Initiative, and HIV/AIDS treatment and cure research at the National Institutes of Health. 

We must also decriminalize HIV transmission and publicly manufacture PrEP, making the drug available to more people.

Sign up now to join our fight to end the HIV/AIDS crisis.
Gold Label: social cultural, safety, social programs, health

text:
Climate change is a crisis дуо but it also represents a once-in-a-generation opportunity to create millions of good-paying American jobs in clean and renewable energy, infrastructure, and manufacturing. 

For too long, there has been a tension between transitioning to a green economy and creating good, union jobs. But we can do both. Iду»ve got a plan to create good new middle class jobs through investments in a clean economy coupled with the strongest possible protections for workers. 

If youду»re ready to tackle the climate crisis and create millions of good, union jobs, sign up now.

Climate change threatens all of us, and we must address it head-on. Itду»s time for a Green New Deal дуо and by ending oil and gas subsidies and reversing Trumpду»s tax cuts for the wealthiest individuals and giant corporations, we can make a down payment on the justice we need. 

The Green New Deal will deploy trillions of dollars to transform the way we source and use energy. In doing so, the government must prioritize resources to support communities hit first and worst by climate change, and correct historic injustices. My friend Governor Jay Inslee rightly challenged us to fund the most vulnerable communities first, and heду»s right. Iду»ll direct one-third of my proposed climate investment into communities that are on the front lines of the climate crisis дуо a commitment that would funnel at least $1 trillion into these areas over the next decade. 

If youду»re ready to fight for justice in our response to the climate crisis, sign up now.

People in underserved communities disproportionately suffer from certain cancers and other pollution-related illnesses. To make matters worse, they are less likely to have access to quality health care. Under Medicare for All, everyone will have high quality health care at a lower cost, allowing disadvantaged communities to get lifesaving services. If youду»re ready to fight for Medicare for All, sign up now.

We have a crisis of environmental injustice, and itду»s the result of ignoring decades of discrimination and environmental racism in underserved communities. For far too long, our government put corporate profits ahead of people. Thatду»s wrong, and it must change. 

Justice must be at the center of our response to climate change. The Green New Deal commits us to a думjust transitionдуќ for all communities and all workers. We must prioritize communities that have experienced historic disinvestment, across their range of needs: affordable housing, better infrastructure, good schools, access to health care, and good jobs. And we must fight to rebuild our unions and create real progress and justice for all workers as we transition to a clean energy economy.

We need strong communities that are prepared and properly resourced to withstand the impacts of climate change. We need big, structural change дуо focused on, and led by, members of these communities. If youду»re ready to fight for environmental justice and a Green New Deal, sign up now.
Gold Label: environmental, economic, social cultural, health, education

text:
Under current law, members of Congress can trade stocks and then use their powerful positions to increase the value of those stocks and pad their own pockets. The solution is simple дуо as president, I will ban members of Congress and senior government officials from owning or trading individual stocks.

Sign up now if youду»re ready to start cleaning up conflicts of interest in Washington.

Giant corporations and powerful interests havenду»t limited their influence-peddling to Congress and the White House. Theyду»ve also turned their attention to the courts. 

Today, every federal judge is bound by a Code of Conduct дус except Supreme Court justices. Itду»s a recipe for corruption. We can fix it by applying the Code of Conduct for United States Judges to Supreme Court justices.  

As President, I will require judges to disclose key information so the American people can verify that their conduct is above ethical reproach. We will also close the loophole that allows federal judges to escape investigations for misconduct by stepping down from their post. 

Sexual assault and perjury complaints against Brett Kavanaugh were dismissed when he was confirmed to the Supreme Court дус thatду»s ridiculous, and Iду»ve got a plan to fix it. Under my plan, investigations will remain open until their findings are made public and any penalties for misconduct are issued. 

Sign up now if youду»re ready to hold our courts accountable to the American people.

Show the American people your plans, and theyду»ll know what your values are. 

Elizabethду»s Ultra-Millionaire Tax would pay for
- Universal child care for every child from birth to school age 
- Student debt cancellation for 95% of people who have it 
- Tuition-free public college and technical school
- A minimum $50 billion fund for HBCUs

We can do a lot by asking ultra-millionaires and billionaires for just two cents. If youду»re with Elizabeth, join your fellow Nevadans and add your name.

text:
Medicare for All is how we ensure that every Granite Stater is covered. 

Costs will go up for the wealthy and for big corporations дуо but they wonду»t go up for middle-class families. I will not sign a bill into law that would raise the costs for middle class families. 

If youду»re with me on this, add your name today.

We have an America thatду»s working better and better for a thinner and thinner slice at the top and leaving everyone else behind. 

This is our moment in history to provide real solutions to the countryду»s biggest problems. I know whatду»s broken, I know how to fix it, and, together with our grassroots movement, Iду»ll fight to get it done. Join other Granite Staters and add your name to be a part of it.

Every election, lobbyists and billionaires try to buy off politicians. Candidates and elected officials often spend hours and hours a day doing думcall timeдуќ or jetting across the country to meet with big donors and corporate CEOs, instead of focusing on policy and working for their constituents. Itду»s corruption дуо and thanks to the Supreme Court, itду»s perfectly legal. Enough is enough. Itду»s time to get big money out of politics.

When Iду»m president, Iду»ll implement a comprehensive plan to permanently eliminate big money from our politics and return power to the people. 

Sign up now if you agree that itду»s time to end the corruption of our democracy.

The system of money for influence is helped, at every stage, by secrecy. In the lead up to the 2016 election, Russian nationals and Kremlin-connected businesses spent money on internet ads to influence American public opinion. Under current law, many of these ads were completely legal. My plan would modernize campaign finance law for the digital age by including internet ads in rules regulating election advertising, requiring large platforms to keep a думpolitical fileдуќ with information about ad buys, just like TV and radio broadcasters do, and requiring large platforms to make reasonable efforts to prevent illegal ad buys by foreign nationals.

If you are ready to regulate political ads on the internet дуо like this one дуо sign up now.

Every election, lobbyists and billionaires try to buy off politicians. Candidates and elected officials often spend hours and hours a day doing думcall timeдуќ with big donors, instead of focusing on policy and working for their constituents. They jet across the country, going from one closed-door fundraiser to another, hearing about the woes and challenges of being a billionaire or corporate CEO. And they court lobbyists and billionaires who can open the doors to thousands of dollars in PAC contributions or millions in super PAC spending. 

Letду»s call this what it is: corruption. And thanks to the Supreme Court, itду»s perfectly legal. The Court has declared that money is speech and corporations are people, and it has struck down many efforts to get big money out of politics. Since Citizens United in 2010, outside groups have more than tripled their spending on candidates and elections. Enough is enough. Itду»s time to get big money out of politics.

When Iду»m president, Iду»ll implement a comprehensive plan to permanently eliminate big money from our politics and return power to the people. 

My plan has three parts: 
 дуў End the corrupt system of money for influence,
 дуў Expand disclosure of fundraising and spending, and 
 дуў Put power back in the hands of the people.

To truly end the corruption of our democracy, we must pass a constitutional amendment to overturn the Supreme Courtду»s decisions in Citizens United and Buckley v. Valeo. A constitutional amendment will allow Congress to regulate election spending, establish public financing as the sole way to finance elections, and bring an end to the era of big money in politics.

Sign up now if you agree itду»s time to get big money out of politics and return power to the people.

Since 2001, arrests for marijuana have increased across the country and now account for over 50 percent of all drug arrests in the United States. The ACLU conducted a thorough study of over 8 million marijuana arrests between 2001 and 2010, and found that 88 percent of those were for marijuana possession. Alarmingly, the study also found that African Americans are 3.73 times more likely to be arrested for marijuana possession than their white peers, even though they use marijuana at similar rates. 

Last year, I introduced the Marijuana Justice Act that would deschedule marijuana at the federal level and allow states to legalize the drug. And very importantly, the bill includes expungement provisions, community reinvestment provisions, and pushes states to correct for any disparate treatment in their enforcement practices. ⠀

I hope everyone who is in favor of legalization will speak up about the urgency of expungement and become an advocate and activist for a broader and more restorative justice. We should legalize marijuana and help those who have suffered due to its prohibition.

Today we honor the men and women who have made the ultimate sacrifice defending the country they loved, we honor those who made the ultimate sacrifice for us, we honor those who fought to keep our nation safe and free, and we are forever in their debt. 

At Memorial Day events across the country today, we see evidence that there is much more that unites us than divides us. The fallen that we remember today came from every town and city, from every background, from every faith, and the heroism, bravery, and service of those we honor today set an example for all of us. Federal marijuana policy has long overstepped the boundaries of common sense, fiscal prudence, and compassion. Not to mention the hypocrisy of presidents, senators and Congress members openly admiring they have done a drug that others in this country, less privileged, have been arrested for. ⠀

I've introduced two bills that would get the federal government out of the marijuana business, end the hypocrisy and embrace common sense. My bills include the bipartisan Compassionate Access, Research Expansion and Respect States (CARERS) Act which would amend federal law to allow states to set their own medical marijuana policies; and most recently, the Marijuana Justice Act—a bill that would end the federal prohibition on of marijuana, allow for the expungement of past marijuana convictions, reinvest in communities disproportionately affected by the drug war, and incentivize states to legalize it at the state level if they disproportionately arrest or incarcerate poor people or people of color. ⠀
⠀
We know medical marijuana has proven benefits—from children suffering from chronic illnesses and seizures, to veterans battling PTSD—and through legalization at the federal level, we can ensure these patients can receive the treatment they need without worrying about the federal government standing in the way.
